text: Lloyd Dee George (February 22, 1930 â€“ October 7, 2020) was an American lawyer and politician. He was born in Montpelier, Idaho. He was nominated to the United States District Court for the District of Nevada in 1984 by President Ronald Reagan. From 1992 to 1997, he was Chief Justice. George died on October 7, 2020 in Las Vegas, Nevada at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from Las Vegas Category:Politicians from Idaho Category:Politicians from Las Vegas Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Idaho
title: Lloyd D. George
